page.title: 19 Changes in Monks Kirby.
page.content: Mrs.Hopkins,who runs the Post Office has seen changes she has liked and some she has not.In the 49 years she has lived in Monks Kirby she has witnessed the building of many new houses which in turn have brought new faces into the village.The increase in traffic to and from the school has made life quite difficult along the narrow lanes of the village at times. Mrs.Tennant and Mrs.Leech recent occupants of some of the new houses think the village is very nice as it is because it is small enough to know every one and although they miss the closeness of amenities such as theatres and libraries they consider that,for the children,the privilage of living and growing up in the country side is more than adequate compensation.
